name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Academy Plaza Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is just off Upper O'Connell Street, and has a lot of restaurants and stores in the immediate area. The rooms are a little small but clean and comfortable and quiet. The airport bus stop is just across the street, it is close to the Hop On/Hop Off bus, and is about a 10 minute walk to Temple Bar.
reviews.title: Great Location and Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not a big breakfast eater, so the full Irish breakfast was not a good value for me. I did haveeit once and it was fine, I just don't eat that much for breakfast. There are a couple of stores on the same block that sell fruit, yogurt, juices, etc., although there is no refrigerator in the room so I usually had to go out in the morning to buy things.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did get the Chinese buffet dinner one time, and it was good and a good price. But we didn't want to do that every night.
reviews.title: excellent location, friendly staff and great value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real problem we had was that we tried to leave a note at the desk to give to others in our party. But they would just take the note and type it into the hotel messages and it could not be seen until you went to your room and looked on the tv. This was not very convenient for us.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: I will definitely book here the next time I visit Dublin, assuming the price stays reasonable.
reviews.title: Great location, tiny, tiny rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, the Best Western name and the location to major attractions in Dublin. Pictures shown of the hotel both on their website and Trip Advisor are very accurate. Our room was comfortable and fully renovated to modern standards. It was a good sized room and more like a North American hotel room than those of the small European variety. Our room had a queen size bed and flat screen TV with a very modern and updated bathroom. Wireless Internet is free throughout the hotel and there are 2 computers in the main lobby which are free for guest use. They were quite busy though.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at the front desk are friendly and outgoing. They did not hesitate to answer any questions we had and they even went out of their way to give us walking directions to Croke Park. Check in and check out was fast and friendly with specific attention paid to our comfort in the hotel. The lounge staff were attentive and provided great service. We did not eat at the hotel, but there is a buffet available for both breakfast and dinner. You can also order from the lounge menu if you like.
reviews.title: Excellent accommadations

reviews.text: The Green Hop On Hop Off bus can be caught right across the street from the hotel and this allows easy access to all of Dublin's major attractions. We walked to the Temple Bar area 2 nights in a row and it is an easy jaunt. The Air Coach bus line is also very convenient to this hotel, as the stops are on O'Connell Street which runs perpendicular to the hotel and is only a few steps away.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to those looking for 4 star quality at reasonable rates (89 Euros / night) with the ability to tour Dublin with ease.
reviews.title: Very average hotel at a premium price

reviews.text: I stayed at the Best Western Plus for a total of 4 nights. It is in a great location. It is right off of O'Connell Street, one of the main drags in Dublin, and a walk away from other Dublin sights. The room was clean, modern and comfortable. We booked a king size bed room and there was plenty of room for us and our luggage. The front desk was very warm and welcoming. I have no comment on their food because I did not have any meals there, but if you want breakfast, it can be included in the room price. It also had free wifi for guests and two computers in the lobby that you can use. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: WE WOULD LIK E TO MAKE THIS OUR HOTEL EVERY YEAR IN JUNE

reviews.text: The free internet is an outstanding perk which offsets how strict they were with checkout times. Located across the street from the hop on hop off bus, the airport shuttle and within walking distance to Temple Bar and Trinity College.
reviews.title: Great Value and excellent location

reviews.text: Hotels in Dublin are quite expensive... and this hotel is a decent option in the city center. It won't rock your world: the rooms are tiny (think: shoebox), it was crowded with students, and service was so-so. The room had practically no storage space (I had my suitcase sitting on top of the in-room safe, and my jacket hanging on the hook-mounted ironing board), and the bathroom and shower are in keeping with the minuscule room.The a/c was noisy, and I used my earplugs to sleep; opening the window wasn't an option, as the noisy a/c units were right outside my window. But, as to the good: the room was clean and had free WiFi, so if you aren't going to be spending a lot of time in your room, and you're looking for a reasonably-priced option, it will work. The location is pretty good -- a short walk from Trinity College, and less than a block from the airport bus stop.
reviews.title: Acceptable Stay in Pricey Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was leery about the hotel restaurant (hardly anyone was eating there), but was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food, and the gracious service I enjoyed there.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: BTW, if you are wanting to use a Best Western gift card, let them know at the start of your stay... they refused to trouble themselves with it when I was checking out.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and convenient for Dublin

reviews.text: We arrived from California early in the morning and were very tired; unfortunately, our room would not be ready for a few hours, so we stored our luggage in a room by the lobby and walked around for a couple of hours until the room was ready. There is a nice sitting area in the lobby where a tired soul could sit until their room is ready. We requested a quiet room and stayed in 617. There was no view but it was really very quiet! The room was a good size with a nice bathroom. The hotel is centrally located and we could walk to just about everything. We would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel that could potentionally be great...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected the hotel for its location and in some ways price as it seemed very reasonable for the price and it included breakfast.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel , in OK location but I think you could do better. Rooms a bit small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location I would say is in an OK location as it is near the party distric but in retrospect we wernt into that type of holiday and there were alot of drunken drugged out Yobbos walking around and the area didnt have an overall great feel about it.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The more I think about it the more I probably would not stay in the area again as it didnt give us a good initial impression of Dublin.
reviews.title: Good hotel - poor problem follow-up

reviews.text: The rooms were ok, a bit small (actually very small) which is normal for Europe, the rooms were a bit tired, no views to speak of unless you loke looking and rusted out roof tops that overlook loud beer gardens and airconditioning systems, but again, we didnt book it for the views!
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Wonderful Location!

reviews.text: The bed was HO HUM as was the room which was a bit tired and dated but it did the job...
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

description: BEST WESTERN PLUS ACADEMY PLAZA HOTEL is located in the heart of Dublin, just off the capital's main thoroughfare. This Best Western hotel boasts 304 stunning new bedrooms and suites, with modern facilities in all rooms. Hotel amenities include a stunning marbled lobby, Sir Harry’s Grill Bar & Bistro, 5 meeting rooms, an On Site Fitness Room, Beauty Salon and complimentary WiFi access throughout the entire hotel.
